We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, Mr Eric Schmidt said. of inner peace," said Erika, who adopted one of the Michael Vick dogs, Oliver, and didn't want her last name used because she doesn't want herself or Oliver to be targeted for harassment. But I thought, no, no, no, don't get angry. Don't let a person like that ruin you. If I can't control what happens to him, I can control what happens to me and I can channel this anger into a big bunch of love. And so, she met Oliver, the dog they said would never kiss a human, but who now sleeps with his pet parent and showers her with kisses every morning when she wakes up.

"As it has grown into the dominant company in Silicon Valley, Google has lost some of its entrepreneurial culture and become a slower-moving bureaucracy, analysts and insiders say," Miller and Helft report. To counter this, the company announced that Larry Page , its 38-year-old co-founder, would take over as chief executive from Eric Schmidt , a technology industry veteran who was brought in a decade ago to provide adult supervision, as Silicon Valley calls it.
